abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Economic
            Management and Governance Reform Grant Project for the
            Central African Republic (CAR) were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: a
            development policy operation can be an effective instrument
            for addressing key issues in restoring a functional
            government and contribute to setting the stage for deeper
            reforms. A programmatic series of DPOs may be better than
            stand-alone Development Policy Operations (DPOs), which may
            provide a timely response to exogenous shocks but could lead
            to inappropriate sequencing of the reforms over the medium
            term. Going forward the new DPO series should seek to link
            more strongly the public sector and economic governance
            reforms with measures to promote private sector development.
            A two-tranche budget support operation can be effective in
            supporting the continuation of reforms, especially in
            fragile countries. The project, a two-tranche grant
            disbursing on agreed conditions, helped maintain the focus
            on critical reforms and ensured that the Bank remain engaged
            in policy dialogue with the authorities before and after the
            elections. The second tranche helped support the
            government's efforts to restore fiscal discipline
            following election-related slippages. Its disbursement
            helped clear arrears which, in turn, permitted other donors
            including the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the
            African Development Bank to move forward with their support
            program. In a fragile post-conflict country such as the CAR,
            Technical Assistance (TA) should be available to help
            implement the reform program supported by the DPO and build
            up capacity in key areas. TA should promote synergies and
            built on them. The policy measures under the project that
            were most successfully implemented were those that benefited
            from greater cooperation among the departments and units
            concerned. To help build robust budget processes, reforms
            should be closely monitored and a close dialogue with the
            government should be maintained through frequent supervision
            missions and a strong field presence.
